version.title: Vagrant.configure Version
version.description: All Vagrant configuration is done below. The '2' in Vagrant.configure configures the configuration version (we support older styles for backwards compatibility). Please don't change it unless you know what you're doing.

name.title: Server VM Image
name.description: Every Vagrant development environment requires a box. You can search for boxes at https://vagrantcloud.com/search.

url.title: Location from which to download the VM Image

check_for_update.title: Enable Automatic VM Image Updates
check_for_update.description: Disable automatic box update checking. If you disable this, then boxes will only be checked for updates when the user runs `vagrant box outdated`. This is not recommended.

network_type.title: Network type; either public or private
network_type.description: Create a private network, which allows host-only access to the machine using a specific IP Address, or create a public network, which generally matched to bridged network. Bridged networks make the machine appear as another physical device on your network.

ip_address.description: Host-only access to the machine using this specific IP Address.

port_fwds.title: Port Forwarding for VM network
port_fwds.description: Create a forwarded port mapping which allows access to a specific port within the machine from a port on the host machine. In the example below, accessing 'localhost:8080' will access port 80 on the guest machine. NOTE: This will enable public access to the opened port

from_host_ip.title: Public Access Host IP Address
from_host_ip.description: Create a forwarded port mapping which allows access to a specific port within the machine from a port on the host machine and only allow access via 127.0.0.1 to disable public access

guest.title: Guest Port forwarded to host port

host.title: Host Port to access forwarded guest port

fs_syncs.description: Share an additional folder to the guest VM. The first argument is the path on the host to the actual folder. The second argument is the path on the guest to mount the folder. And the optional third argument is a set of non-required options.

host.title: Path on the host to the actual folder

guest.title: Path on the guest to mount the folder
